result.value:
If you use Neuro-Nav in your research or educational material, please cite the work as follows:

```
@inproceedings{neuronav2022,
  Author = {Juliani, Arthur and Barnett, Samuel and Davis, Brandon and Sereno, Margaret and Momennejad, Ida},
  Title = {Neuro-Nav: A Library for Neurally-Plausible Reinforcement Learning},
  Year = {2022},
  BookTitle = {The 5th Multidisciplinary Conference on Reinforcement Learning and Decision Making},
}
```

The research paper corresponding to the above citation can be found [here](https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.03312).

result.author: Juliani, Arthur and Barnett, Samuel and Davis, Brandon and Sereno, Margaret and Momennejad, Ida
result.title: Neuro-Nav: A Library for Neurally-Plausible Reinforcement Learning

result.value:
Neuro-Nav is an open source project, and we actively encourage community contributions.
These can take various forms, such as new environments, tasks, algorithms, bug fixes, documentation, citations of relevant work, or additional experiment notebooks.
If there is a small contribution you would like to make, please feel free to open a pull request, and we can review it.
If there is a larger contribution you are considering, please open a github issue. This way, the contribution can be discussed, and potential support can be provided if needed.
If you have ideas for changes or features you would like to see in the library in the future, but don't have the resources to contribute yourself, please feel free to open a github issue describing the request.
A library for neuroscience-inspired navigation and decision making research.

Neuro-Nav is an open-source library for neurally plausible reinforcement learning (RL). It offers a set of standardized environments and RL algorithms drawn from canonical behavioral and neural studies in rodents and humans. In addition, this repository also contains a set of jupyter notebooks which reproduce various experimental results from the literature.
Contains two highly parameterizable environments: `GridEnv` and `GraphEnv`. Each comes with a variety of task templates, observation spaces, and other settings useful for research.

Contains artifical agents which implement over a dozen cannonical reinforcement learning algorithms, including: Temporal Difference (TD) and Dyna versions of Q-Learning, Successor Representation, and Actor-Critic algorithms.
Contains a set of deep reinforcement learning algorithms implemented in PyTorch. These include Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) and Soft Actor-Critic (SAC).

Neuro-nav includes a number of interactive jupyter notebooks, featuring different experimental environments, tasks, and RL agent algorithms. You can use these notebooks to replicate various experiments across the literature, or to simply learn about what's possible to do with the library. Notebooks include those that replicate results from computational neuroscience, psychiatry, and machine learning.

The easiest way to install the `neuronav` package is by running the following command:

```
pip install 'git+https://github.com/awjuliani/neuro-nav'
```

This will provide the environments and algorithms, but not the jupyter notebooks. If you would like access to the notebooks as well, you can locally download the repository, and then install `neuronav` by running the following command from the root of the directory where the repository is downloaded to:

```
pip install -e .
```

If you would like to use the experiment notebooks as well as the core library, please run `pip install -e .[experiments_local]` from the root of this directory to install the additional dependencies.

It is also possible to access all notebooks using google colab. The links to the colab notebooks can be found [here](./notebooks/README.md).

result.description:
### New features

* Adds support for manual reward collection in `GridEnv` using the `manual_collect` flag on initialization.

Thanks to @quendera for contributing this feature.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 2.3.0

result.description: * Display reward value in `symbolic` observations of `GridEnv`.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 2.2.0

result.description: * Fixes bug where `GridEnv` would crash when run on a machine without a display.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 2.1.1

result.description:
* Add `torch_obs` flag to `GraphEnv`.
* Fix bug in 3d observation dimension order in `GridEnv`.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 2.1.0

result.description:
* Add Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) algorithm.
* Add Soft Actor-Critic (SAC) algorithm.
* Add Deep-RL tutorial notebook.
* Fix bug in symbolic observation in `GridEnv`.
* Miscellaneous documentation improvements.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 2.0.0

result.description: * Fix bug in 2D grid rendering
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.5.5

result.description:
* Use caching to significantly improve render time for visual observations in `GridEnv`.
* Other minor performance improvements to `GridEnv`.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.5.4

result.description: * Fix no-op bug and add test to cover this feature in the future.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.5.3

result.description: * Add missing `PyVirtualDisplay` dependency to `setup.py`.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.5.2

result.description: * Fix rendering bug with complex rewards.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.5.1

result.description:
* Adds support for 3D rendering in `GridEnv` using `renderer_3d` `obs_type`.
* Miscellaneous code improvements.

![test](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9065325/227334277-6a454924-b993-4fad-a029-166b8dfd5f9e.gif)
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.5.0

result.description:
* Implements a `MoodQ` agent which uses mood to modulate value updates.
* Adds a notebook to demonstrate the algorithm and the relationship between reward, value, advantage, and mood.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.4.0

result.description:
* Add 3x3 observation types (`symbolic_window_tight` and `window_tight`) to `GridEnv`.
* Rename `observation_space` to more succinct `obs_space`.
* Fix a few minor bugs.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.3.0

result.description: * Adds support for invisible walls in `GridEnv`.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.2.0

result.description:
* Allow for per-reward termination logic in `GridEnv`.
* Add support for door orientation in `GridEnv`.
* Update object visuals for better readability in `GridEnv`.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.1.0

result.description:
* Remove 'beta' tags from readme pages.
* Add support for warp locations in `GridEnv`.
* Add support for invisible reward locations in `GridEnv`.
* Add support for stochastic action-mapping in `GridEnv` and `GraphEnv`.
* Add support for seeding `GridEnv` and `GraphEnv`.
* Add support for no-op actions in `GridEnv` and `GraphEnv`.
* Rename `GridTopography` to `GridTemplate`.
* Rename `GraphStructure` to `GraphTemplate`.
* Rename `GridObsType` to `GridObservation`.
* Rename `GraphObsType` to `GraphObservation`.
* Rename `OrientationType` to `GridOrientation`.
* Changes to `GridEnv` and `GraphEnv` constructor argument names.
* Improvements to tests.
result.name: Neuro-Nav 1.0.0

result.description:
* Adds episodic control (QEC) algorithm.
* Adds monte-carlo version of q-learning algorithm (QMC).
* Adds SARSA algorithm (SARSA).
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.12.0

result.description:
* Refactor `reward_locs` into more general `objects` dict in `GridEnv` and `GraphEnv`.
* Add support for `markers` which can arbitrarily color locations in `GridEnv`.
* Add support for `keys` and `doors` in `GridEnv`.
* Use `two_rooms` environment as a demonstration of keys and doors.
* Add `symbolic` and `symbolic_window` observation types for `GridEnv`.

Special thanks to @adamimos for contributing to this release.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.11.0

result.description:
* Rewrite the `visual` and `window` observation types to use a new OpenCV-based renderer.
* Use new renderer for `GridEnv.render()` as well.
* Fix minor bugs in two `GridEnv` environment topographies.
* Re-render relevant notebooks which use `GridEnv`.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.10.0

result.description:
* Remove linear policies (increases performance/compatibility).
* Refactor agent code (Q-learning style algorithms now inherit from `QAgent` parent class).
* Support time penalties in `GridEnv` and `GraphEnv`.
* Use more consistent interface between `GridEnv` and `GraphEnv` for reward function definition.
* Increase functionality of `utils. plot_values_and_policy`.
* Add `two_step` and `narrow` `GridEnv` tasks.
* Rename `OrientationType.dynamic` to `OrientationType.variable`.
* Proper support for visual observations at 100x100 resolution.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.9.0

result.description:
### New Notebooks
* Adds a new CCN 2022 Tutorial notebook.
* Adds notebook with replications of Figures 1 and 4 from Zorowitz et al., 2020.

### New Features
* Makes reward function definition consistent between `GridEnv` and `GraphEnv`.
* Adds a value/policy plotting function to the `utils` module.
* Renders reward magnitudes in `GraphEnv.render()`.
* Extends functionality of `run_episode` function by additionally returning return information.
* Support termination of episode on reward for `GridEnv`.

### Bug fixes and other improvements
* Adds algorithm hyperparameter documentation.
* Adds type hints and doc strings to many of the functions.
* Refactor `MBV` code.
* Fixes bug in `MBV` argument order.
* Fixes typo in `GridEnv` function documentation.
* Restructures list of notebooks by breaking them into distinct categories.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.8.0

result.description:
* Fixes bug in environment rendering when not reset.
* Fixes typo in grid topography documentation.
* Adds micro grid size for use in toy problems.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.7.1

result.description:
* Modify agent algorithms to support linear policies where applicable.
* Adds an example of using a linear policy to usage tutorial.
* Refactors agent algorithms to reduce duplicate code.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.7.0

result.description:
Adds code to partially replicate results from ["A distributional code for value in dopamine-based reinforcement learning"](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-019-1924-6). Including:

* The optimistic/pessimistic distributional RL algorithm.
* The variable magnitude reward task.
* A notebook to replicate relevant part of Figure 2 from the original paper.
* Support for probabilistic graph transitions in `GraphEnv`.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.6.0

result.description:
* Adds a tabular eligibility trace algorithm.
* Minor visual improvements to the temporal community structure notebook.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.5.0

result.description:
* Make `GridEnv` and `GraphEnv` reward interfaces more consistent.
* Support negative rewards in `GridEnv`.
* Add `obstacle` topography for `GridEnv`.
* Update successor notebook with example using `obstacle` topography.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.4.1

result.description:
* Adds experimental notebook demonstrating temporal community structure in computational models.
* Move notebook helper functions into neuronav package to fix colab import issues.
* Add torch as optional dependency for notebooks.
* Minor bug fixes and documentation improvements.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.4.0

result.description:
* Add more informative tables to algorithm, environment, and notebook documentation pages.
* Add support for google colab versions of notebooks.
* Add Apache 2 license to project.
* Add contributing and citation information to documentation.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.3.1

result.description:
* Split tutorial notebook into tutorial and representation notebooks.
* Add goal bias flag for SR agents.
* Fix bug in neighborhood graph structure.
* Fix package structure and setup.py
* Prepare for colab support.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.3.0

result.description: * Improve consistency of graph experiment 2 in https://github.com/awjuliani/neuro-nav/pull/5.
result.name: Neuro-Nav (Beta) 0.2.1

result.value: Requirements for the `neuronav` library can be found [here](./setup.py).
